result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kiarra N Cook

records.addlTxt: Attorney Paul M. Fredrickson contacted the Court to request cases be set for Trial.

Reporter: Jeanne Farino-Malagold
4/26/22 Initial Appearance
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). $500 previously posted. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
 - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
 - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
 - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. Court authorizes Def to be away from her residence to attend a funeral in Mississippi from 6/30/22 - 7/6/22, returning on or before 10pm on 7/6/22. NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

10:49 AM Defendant Kiarra N Cook in court with Attorney Jack Idlas on behalf of Attorney Will Rice Anderson and Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Re: Motion for Bail Modification Hearing
Statement by Attorney Idlas in support of Motion. Statement by Defendant's Mother, T.H. in support of Motion. State objects to Motion for reasons stated on the record. Rebuttal by Attorney Idlas. Statement by Defendant. Court removes gps monitoring as a condition. $500 bond previously posted.
All other conditions remain the same.

Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

01:34 PM Defendant in court, in custody from the JRC with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
